entries.meaning: (Canada) A building, such as a duplex or triplex, with a number of apartments (typically two to four) that all open directly to the outside.
examples: Most new housing has taken the form of single-family dwellings, not plexes, and levels of home ownership have risen steadily.

entries.meaning: (computing) A designated portion of a disk, usually set up to mirror some of the contents.
examples: Striped volumes of mirrored plexes can survive failure of up to half of their disks.
